item.title: China Will Hike Quota for Investors Buying Overseas Assets
item.description: China will allow some local investors to put more of their money into overseas assets, a sign Beijing is opening up its financial market as the yuan steadies.
item.dc:creator: Tian Chen, Wenjin Lv, Zheng Li

item.title: Oil Rally Builds as Middle East Tensions Deepen: Markets Wrap
item.description: Oil extended its recent gains amid concern escalating tensions in the Middle East will trigger more direct US involvement. Asian stocks were mixed before a Federal Reserve monetary policy decision.
item.dc:creator: Rob Verdonck, Abhishek Vishnoi

item.title: Oil Holds Advance as Trump Spurs Middle East Escalation Concerns
item.description: Oil steadied after rallying around 10% since Israel started its attacks on Iran last week, as speculation the US may join the conflict stoked concerns about supply disruptions in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen, Rob Verdonck

media:content.media:description: Oil storage tanks at the Sunoco LP Terminal in Crockett, California, US, on Friday, Jan. 3, 2025. Oil began 2025 by rising to the highest level since November, boosted by a report of shrinking crude stockpiles in the US and bullish technical indicators. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Hedge Fund Traders Are Pushing Their Firms Into Dubai and Abu Dhabi
item.description: The rush of hedge funds heading to the UAE has been driven by the need to keep star traders happy. Escalating conflict in the region hasn’t deterred them so far.
item.dc:creator: Nishant Kumar, Bei Hu, Hema Parmar

media:content.media:description: Dubai is home to more than 75 hedge funds, up from 10 or so a decade ago.

item.title: EQT Founder Backs Startup Swebal With Plans to Build TNT Factory
item.description: Swedish defense startup Swebal has raised €3 million ($3.5 million) from investors including Thomas von Koch, the co-founder of private equity firm EQT AB, to help it construct a factory manufacturing the explosive material TNT.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Jungstedt

media:content.media:description: Thomas Fuller/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images)

item.title: Energy CEOs Comment on Impact of Escalating Middle East Tensions
item.description: While speaking at a conference in Tokyo, the chief executives of Woodside Energy, JERA Co. and TotalEnergies commented on the impact of rising tensions in the Middle East on oil and gas markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: PBOC Chief Sees Currency Competition as Dollar Dominance Falters
item.description: People’s Bank of China Governor Pan Gongsheng laid out in the clearest terms yet his vision for the future of a new global currency order after decades of dollar dominance, predicting a more competitive system will take root in the years to come.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Wenjin Lv, Yujing Liu, Zheng Li

item.title: TotalEnergies Says It Can Replace Russian Gas With Growing LNG Supply
item.description: TotalEnergies SE sees abundant alternatives to Russian gas as the European Union proposes a ban on all deliveries from the country by the end of 2027. "The good news is that the LNG market will be well supplied from 2027, 2028 and 2029,” the company’s Chief Executive Officer Patrick Pouyanne says at an energy conference in Tokyo. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Korean Cosmetics Firm Kolmar Shares Jump 25% as Founder Sues Son
item.description: Shares of South Korean cosmetics maker Kolmar Holdings Co. jumped as much as 25% after a subsidiary confirmed its founder sued to reclaim shares gifted to his eldest son.
item.dc:creator: Youkyung Lee, Shinhye Kang

item.title: Oil Options More Bullish Than After Russia’s Invasion of Ukraine
item.description: Oil options are now more bullish than after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in 2022, showing a global market that’s on edge as Israel and Iran trade blows, and speculation mounts that the US may join the attack.
item.dc:creator: Yongchang Chin

item.title: Caris Life Sciences IPO Prices Above Range to Raise $494 Million
item.description: Caris Life Sciences Inc., a health-care company that uses technology to help diagnose and treat cancer, raised $494 million in a US initial public offering that priced above the top of its marketed range.
item.dc:creator: Angel Adegbesan, Anthony Hughes

item.title: Diesel Prices Surge as Israel-Iran War Adds Market Pressure
item.description: Diesel prices kept rising on Tuesday as concerns about Middle Eastern supplies — a consequence of the Israel-Iran conflict — piled pressure on an already tight market.
item.dc:creator: Jack Wittels

media:content.media:description: A person refuels a trailer truck with diesel fuel at a Petron Corp. gas station near West Port Klang, Selangor, Malaysia, on Sunday, July 21, 2024. Malaysia expects the move toward targeted diesel assistance will save the government about 4 billion ringgit ($848 million) a year, and has vowed to follow that up with unwinding blanket subsidies for RON95, the country’s cheapest and most commonly used gasoline.

item.title: New World Seals Deal for Louis Vuitton’s New Hong Kong Megastore
item.description: Hong Kong’s New World Development Co. has secured an agreement with Louis Vuitton to open a new megastore in the financial hub, according to people familiar with the matter, as global luxury giants eye bigger, more unique spaces to lure wealthy shoppers.
item.dc:creator: Shirley Zhao, Haze Fan

item.title: Tanking China Coking Coal Market Gets Respite After Output Halts
item.description: Chinese coking coal futures have staged a rare recovery this month, with the latest gains driven by temporary halts to production in the mining hub of Shanxi as regulators conduct environmental assessments.
item.dc:creator: Dan Murtaugh

item.title: Traders Pile Into Bets That Next Fed Chair Will Slash US Rates
item.description: US rates traders have amassed a record futures bet that the Federal Reserve will take on a more dovish tilt right after Chair Jerome Powell’s term ends in May 2026.
item.dc:creator: Edward Bolingbroke

media:content.media:description: Television stations broadcast Jerome Powell, chairman of the US Federal Reserve, speaking after a Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Wednesday, May 7, 2025. Federal Reserve officials held interest rates steady for a third-straight meeting and emphasized they see a growing risk of both higher inflation and rising unemployment.

item.title: CEO’s Wealth Hits $33 Billion as Unprofitable Chinese Medicine Firm’s Stock Soars
item.description: A blistering rally in a tiny, money-losing traditional Chinese medicine company’s stock has vaulted its founder’s net worth to among the world’s largest fortunes.
item.dc:creator: Dylan Sloan
